channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump mulls Tomahawk deliveries to Ukraine if Russia keeps war going
item.description: President Donald Trump calls Tomahawk missiles a 'new step of aggression' while considering sending the weapons to Ukraine against Russia.

item.title: The immigration crackdown is ‘much, much worse’ for business than tariffs, some CEOs say
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Trump starts week in Middle East, overseeing historic peace agreement
item.description: President Trump oversees landmark Israel-Hamas agreement in Middle East trip, meeting hostage families and addressing the Knesset before Egypt summit.

item.title: Wall Street thinks China is winning Trump’s trade war
item.description: China holds an unexpectedly strong hand in the trade war, and the U.S.’s tariffs have been counterintuitively positive for China.

item.title: Dow futures jump nearly 400 points as markets eye another serving of the TACO trade after Trump says ‘Don’t worry about China’
item.description: "Highly respected President Xi just had a bad moment. He doesn’t want Depression for his country, and neither do I. The U.S.A. wants to help China, no...

item.title: Vance warns the longer the shutdown goes on, ‘the deeper the cuts are going to be’ as White House prepares to fire over 4,000 workers
item.description: “To be clear, some of these cuts are going to be painful. This is not a situation that we relish."

item.title: Vance warns 'deeper' cuts ahead for federal workers as shutdown enters 12th day
item.description: Vice President JD Vance on Sunday said there will be deeper cuts to the federal workforce the longer the government shutdown goes on, adding to the un...

item.title: Himes calls Trump administration's strikes on alleged drug cartel boats 'illegal killings'
item.description: The top Democrat on the House Intelligence Committee has condemned President Trump's deadly military strikes on boats allegedly operated by narcoterro...

item.title: Dems Quietly Pull Back on Medicaid for Illegal Immigrants
item.description: Taxpayers deserve better than symbolic compassion backed by shell games and ballooning deficits.

item.title: Twinless, an Exercise in Attention to Detail
item.description: The film features characters that are so nuanced that they feel real.

item.title: Birth Centers Promote Birth Freedom and Health Care Abundance
item.description: Restricting proven models of care is indefensible.

item.title: Trump refuses to rule out striking Venezuela. What's next for Trump's war on drugs?
item.description: President Donald Trump has launched military strikes against drug cartels in the Caribbean, threatening to blow narco-terrorists out of existence.

item.title: Trump says Hamas may release 20 hostages ‘a little bit early’ as he heads to Middle East
item.description: Hamas faces deadline to return all hostages to Israel under peace agreement brokered by President Donald Trump following October 7, 2023 attacks.

item.title: Neither side flinches as shutdown pain intensifies, thousands of federal workers lose their jobs
item.description: The government shutdown is taking a heavy toll on federal workers, with 4,000 receiving layoff notices as President Trump ratchets up the pressure on ...

item.title: Trump warns Russia he may send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if war isn’t settled soon in ‘a new step of aggression’
item.description: “Do they want to have Tomahawks going in that direction? I don’t think so,” Trump said of Russia. “I think I might speak to Russia about that.”

item.title: Looking for a Violent Plot in One Place, Ignoring It Another
item.description: The press was eager to cover a mysterious South Carolina house fire but neglected an obvious plot against conservative Supreme Court justices.

item.title: Democrats praise Trump, his administration for Israel-Hamas ceasefire breakthrough
item.description: The historic ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas has prompted an unexpected response from some prominent Democrats.

item.title: Spanberger quiet on twin controversies in final stretch of Virginia race
item.description: Democratic gubernatorial hopeful Abigail Spanberger faces mounting scrutiny over two controversies ahead of Virginia’s election, among them Jay Jones’...

item.title: Trump jokes about his eternal fate: 'I think I am not maybe heaven-bound'
item.description: President Trump joked Sunday that he might not be destined for the Pearly Gates.

item.title: The Utterly Unsurprising ‘Revelation’ That the FBI Perused Senators’ Phone Records
item.description: Why is anyone shocked to hear that the FBI perused senators’ phone records around the time of a riot at the Capitol over which the president had been ...

item.title: Spanberger Won’t Condemn School Board Member For Sympathetic Emails To Sex Offender Using Girls’ Bathroom
item.description: A Spanberger spokeswoman refused to address the then-candidate's exchange of sympathetic emails with sex offender Richard Kenneth Cox.

item.title: Democrats Are Giving Up On Democracy
item.description: It doesn’t matter how unpopular Democrats’ policies are, they are not going to negotiate, they are not going to compromise.

item.title: Katie Porter’s Nasty, Abusive Attitude Is Standard, Antisocial Democrat Behavior
item.description: You simply do not hear stories about berated staff from Republicans in Congress or the West Wing. Antisocial behavior is a Democrat thing.

item.title: Margaret Thatcher Docudrama Shows What Media Corruption Stole From Us
item.description: Brian and Maggie shows how a good interviewer can still reveal much about a subject that the subject does not necessarily want to reveal.
